item.title: About me
item.description: I received my PhD in July 2020 jointly from KU Leuven (Belgium) and IMT Lucca (Italy), under the supervision of Prof. Panagiotis Patrinos and Prof. Alberto Bemporad. My PhD thesis can be found here. Currently my research focuses on nonsmooth and (non)-convex optimization problems, and their applications to machine learning and signal processing.

item.title: Related software
item.description: A solver for large scale finite sum minimization problems: CIAOAlgorithms.jl. See the github page for more details. Primal-dual algorithms presented in here and here have been implemented as part of the generic Julia solver ProximalAlgorithms.jl. See also the github repository KUL-ForBES for other related packages developed in our group.
